file_content.text: Bug someone else. I just work here.
If you don't spit out what you want, you're gonna get a grenade without the pin.
This is just too good. I get slick equipment, a nice ride and a ready supply of every explosive there ever was.
I think this will do. Boss.
I try to run a good outfit.
Glad you approve.
I'm sure you do.
Does this mean you can actually follow orders once in a while?
So I'm the boss, now?
Stranger things have happened.
You aren't here to have fun, Vik.
This isn't a vacation.
Is it really that bad if I enjoy my work?
Trust me: You keep me happy, I'll keep you happy.
Now, let's go put some of this fancy equipment to use.
All right, boss. You got me.
Working together like we've been doing--it's a gold mine. If you're up for making this a long-term arrangement, then count me in.
We definitely make a good team, Vik.
Sounds good to me.
Couldn't agree more.
Is this some weird come-on, Vik?
Are you hitting on me?
Don't be dense. You're not nearly trashy enough for me. Plus your people are ugly as Hutts.
Keep finding good ways to make credits, I'll keep working with you.
We'll see.
It's always been a talent of mine.
I'm retiring someday, Vik.
I'm not doing this forever.
Retirement's expensive, boss. More reason to work together and get you a big pile of credits stashed somewhere.
Not a mark in the galaxy that can handle both of us, boss. Let's get out there and make some credits.
That was ridiculous.
Turns out there's two Lord Albreks--a father-son team. A crazy-old-man-and-stuck-up-little-punk team, really.
Neither of them had a single credit, and both of them had promised to sell the guns to three different buyers apiece.
How did you deal with them?
What'd you do?
These guys really gave you a hard time, huh?
Sounds rough.
Tell me about it. If I wanted to work this hard for my money, I'd get a real job.
Just more reasons you should've never tried to pull something like this.
I told you not to go.
Oh, I pulled it off.
It took a lot of wrangling, but I managed to get those two saps into the same room with all of their buyers.
Then I lobbed a couple of grenades in. Most of the buyers' credits were still in one piece afterward, so I'm calling it a win.
Sounds like another job well done, Vik.
Me too.
Little "blow ups" like that are bound to draw some attention, Vik.
I'd call it messy.
I didn't use Rep-issue frags--I'm not an amateur. Anybody who looks will figure it's another arms deal gone bad. Happens all the time.
You murdered eight people just for some credits?
You're insane!
Nah, there were more than that. The buyers wouldn't show up without muscle, after all.
Let's hope the next rundown isn't so tough. The stress might ruin my looks.
Everything's ready, boss. I've got Lord Albrek's location on Alderaan and all of the files that prove the debt.
I just have to walk in, show the files, act tough and we can both become a little bit richer.
Richer is always better.
Good deal.
This guy must have gotten a lot of weapons from Magaran, or he wouldn't owe so much.
Be careful.
Yeah, the old kook bought enough blasters to outfit a whole platoon. He probably can't lift a single one of 'em.
The guy's pushing seventy years old--what could go wrong?
This goes against everything we stand for, Vik.
You're a disgrace.
It doesn't go against anything I stand for.
See you when I've got the credits.
As soon as we catch a break, I'm heading out.
Found our first customer, boss. An Alderaanian noble named Albrek.
He was into Magaran for quite a few credits. Once I work out the final details, it's all ours.
Let me know when everything's ready.
Sounds good.
Magaran's files didn't have everything we need?
What kind of details?
Not gonna chance it. With Alderaan as torn up as it is, it's best to do some research, first.
I don't want any part of this, Vik.
I'm not interested.
You've got to be kidding me!
If you're not in, the whole thing falls apart. You'd be throwing away a huge opportunity for both of us. I don't like missing opportunities, boss.
I guess I can play along.
Fine, I'm in.
You'll be glad you did, trust me.
I've got a good feeling about this, boss. I think this might just be the best plan I've ever been a part of.
Long as we're not kicked out of the military, we'll do pretty well for ourselves.
Don't worry, I'll keep us covered.
We'll be fine.
That's why you're the best.
What got you kicked out before?
How'd it happen last time?
I don't remember half the list of charges. You know me--like to keep busy.
The last straw was a protection racket I ran while I was stationed on Talay. It was really fun while it lasted.
The plan only worked for a few weeks before someone whined to the higher-ups. I was the ringleader, so I took most of the heat.
Not easy being in charge, is it?
The price of leadership.
Nope. Glad I don't have to deal with that nonsense anymore.
Havoc is lucky that you got a second chance.
I'm glad you're back.
Yep. Where would you be without me?
Sounds sloppy. Don't let it happen again.
Don't get me caught.
I wasn't the one who messed up on Talay, and I won't be messing up here.
I'll let you know when everything's lined up. Then I'll go pay the noble Lord Albrek a visit.
Tell me when you've got the intel on Lord Albrek. Until then, we've got places to be.
Let's get back to work.
You got it.
Making a little extra while we're fighting the Imps is one thing. But this is totally different.
I'm sorry, but I can't do it.
Credits are credits.
You're in Havoc Squad, Vik. The best in the Republic. I won't put up with this.
We're not criminals.
Then you're an idiot.
Guess I'll have to find someone else to work this with.
I have to tell you, boss--I'm impressed.
I wasn't sure I'd like coming back to the army, but it's worked out great. Mostly thanks to you.
I'm just lucky to have a good team.
I do my best.
Can't have a good crew without a good boss. Sir.
You sounded eager enough when you first got into Havoc.
You weren't sure?
Well, I knew it'd be better than Balmorra, but I didn't expect to like it this much.
Stop, you're making me misty.
Are you going soft on me?
Yeah, yeah. Very moving stuff.
I've worked with a lot of people over the years. Stupid, greedy people I cut loose as soon as I could.
But you? Actually useful. Even taught me a thing or two in a fight. It's a nice change.
I'd hope the Republic's best squad would be an improvement.
I'll bet.
All I'm saying is that I never thought this would be the place for me. But it is.
I enjoy working with you, too, Vik.
You're pretty handy, too.
Of course you do. These ops wouldn't be any fun without me around.
Being nice won't make me trust you, Vik.
Trying to get my guard down?
You're no fool, boss. That's why I like you.
Come on. Let's get back to that war I keep hearing about.
I've been looking over the customer files from Magaran's office. The guy really didn't know how to run an outfit.
When you're selling guns, you always get the money up front. You only take installments from customers you can grab when they don't pay.
Magaran had installment customers all over the galaxy. And, big surprise, a lot of them never paid off their bills. Amateur.
I'm surprised Magaran would hire people to go after you, but not his debtors.
He didn't send bounty hunters?
He only wanted me dead, and hired killers come cheap these days. Good debt collectors are expensive--you actually have to trust them.
How much money are we talking about, here?
Were the debts very big?
Not a fortune, but nothing to spit at, either. Magaran must have been losing a lot of sleep.
Are you telling me about this for a reason?
Is this going somewhere?
There are credits to be made. People owed Magaran. I took him down, which means his stuff is my stuff now. Sorry--our stuff.
Everyone who owed him owes me, now. I'll look through the lists, find the big debts, and collect--and give you a reasonable cut. How's that sound?
Make it happen, Vik.
Sounds good to me.
You got it, boss.
Do you really think people will pay?
Will it work?
I think we can persuade just about anyone to pay up.
We're Special Forces, not debt collectors!
Forget it!
Who says we can't be both?
Hey boss. Everything's cleared up--no more price on my head. Well, no one to pay it, anyway.
I'm glad you're in the clear now.
That's good to hear.
You and me both.
How exactly did you clear all of this up?
What'd you do?
We hugged and made up. What do you think I did?
I'd better not have to hear about anything like this again.
Don't let this happen again.
What are you so worked up about? You didn't even have to do anything.
I found some of Magaran's files while I was picking through the wreckage afterward. Figured they might come in handy--I'll let you know if I spot anything interesting.
So. Turns out Red Hand Magaran isn't just an idiot with a chip on his shoulder about that weapons deal I bailed on.
He's also an idiot with a lot of bounty hunters on call. He's put a price on my head. I need to take care of it.
Do whatever you need to do, Vik.
Of course.
How exactly are you going to take care of this?
"Take care of it"?
Few kilos of baradium should do the trick.
How is this a surprise for you, Vik?
You're a fool.
What can I say? I knew the guy was dumb, but I didn't think he was dumb enough to try this.
Magaran's office is on Nar Shaddaa. I still know a few people there who don't want me dead, so this shouldn't take long.
Once Magaran's settled, we'll be good to go again.
The faster this is dealt with, the better.
Sounds good.
Couldn't agree more.
I could back you up, if you want.
Need a hand?
Nah. I've been through this a couple of times before--it'll go faster solo. Thanks, though.
"Murdering a gunrunner" isn't one of the acceptable reasons for taking leave.
I don't like this.
Then I'm taking the family to Hologram Fun World. Write up whatever you want.
Be back later.
Let me know as soon I'm good to go.
Hey, come here--this is going to be hilarious. Remember the credits I brought in from that old weapons sale?
Those were from my second buyer. The first guy I lined up wasn't offering as much as I liked, so I bailed on him.
Cheap jerk is all worked up that I sold 'em to someone else--he's trying to put a scare in me.
Wouldn't it be easier to just ignore the guy?
Why call him?
Easier, sure. But this is more fun.
How can I help, exactly?
Just tell me what to do.
Just play along.
I don't have time for this, Vik.
This is stupid.
Too late, I'm getting him on the line now.
Guy's name is "Red Hand" Magaran. He runs a few guns, thinks he's a real tough guy.
Hey there, Red.
My guns, Vik. Where are they?
Well, I was having a chat with my new boss--the commander of Havoc Squad--and we decided to go with another buyer.
If that's the commander of Havoc Squad, I'm the King of Alderaan. I want those guns, Vik.
I assure you, I'm Havoc Squad's CO.
You don't believe us?
I don't know anything about any weapons deals.
I had nothing to do with this!
I hope Vik's paying you good to get on my nerves.
When you back out on a deal with me, there are consequences, Vik. I'll be seeing you.
Uh-oh. "Consequences." I hope I don't lose any sleep.
Sometimes, you don't get what you want.
Too bad. [End call]
Aww. He never even got to threaten us. I was waiting to see if he'd go with torture or the old "kill your family" routine.
We've got bigger things to worry about than some arms dealer.
Let's get back to work.
Yeah, yeah.
I can't believe he thought we'd be scared of him.
That guy was a moron.
No joke. I'm glad we didn't do business with him. We'd look stupid.
Taunting someone like that can only cause problems.
You're insane.
He's nowhere near as tough as he wants people to think.
Come on. Let's find something else to do.
Let me tell you, boss. This is not where I figured I'd end up when I enlisted.
Growing up on Nar Shaddaa, you only joined the army for the free ticket out of there.
You enlisted so you could leave Nar Shaddaa?
Is that why you joined?
You better believe it.
Don't forget the free guns, free armor, free food....
There are lots of other perks.
True enough. It's a sweet deal if you've got nothing.
Does it even matter to you if we win this war?
Don't you care about anything?
Of course it does. I hate losing.
Before the army, I ran with whatever gang had the loosest boss and the most spare detonite.
Had a long list of enemies. Even street trash take it bad when you blow up their buddies.
Joining the army is an interesting escape plan.
So you enlisted.
Worked like a charm. I'm alive, and most of those scumbags aren't.
Do you ever wish you could go home again?
Ever miss Nar Shaddaa?
I've been back to that slime hole plenty of times. The heat's more than died down now.
We'd better not run into any of your old enemies looking for revenge.
Will they come after us?
Most of the guys who wanted me dead have killed each other off by now. It won't be a problem.
Joining up turned out to be the best idea I ever had. Lot more fun than running with those scrubs back on the streets. Most of the time.
Sounds like everything worked out for you.
Glad you're happy.
It's why I've got this sunny disposition.
What's not to like?
Most of the time?
Lot of rules, can't just beat down the people who come to enforce 'em. Have to play nice--or smart.
Enough reminiscing. Let's go trash something, huh?
Let's get back to work.
Enough chat.
Suits me.
All right, boss. Time to talk some business.
Bunch of credits just came through from a weapons deal I had going on Balmorra--another weapons deal I had going back on Balmorra. This is your cut.
I could get used to this.
Nice!
How many schemes do you have going, Vik?
Another weapons deal?
They're not schemes--they're opportunities. And not just for me.
I can't take these credits.
Then give 'em to a charity. Toss 'em out the air lock--I don't care.
You're the new boss--you get a cut, no matter what.
Let's have a word when we're back on the ship, boss.
Need to talk to you when we get a chance.
Not looking to chat right now.
Boss.
I'll be right behind you. Trust me.
I'm going in!
All right, all right. So much for enjoying the moment.
This is going to be fun, I can tell already.
You're a pro, no doubt about it.
Whatever you say.
I'm sure that won't be a problem.
Heh. Let's see, now....
Heh. Come on, boss. Let's get out of here.
All right, all right. Now beat it.
Oh, come on! Now what?
Yeah, yeah. Sir.
Let's get to it.
You've got to be kidding me!
You got it.
